edu.washington.cs.cse490h.lib
Class Simulator

java.lang.Object
  edu.washington.cs.cse490h.lib.Manager
      edu.washington.cs.cse490h.lib.Simulator

public class Simulator
extends Manager

Manages a simulation, where all nodes are running in the same process, in the same thread

Constructor Detail

Simulator

public Simulator(java.lang.Class<? extends Node> nodeImpl,
                 java.lang.Long seed,
                 java.lang.String replayOutputFilename,
                 java.lang.String replayInputFilename)
          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                 java.io.IOException
Base constructor for the Simulator. Does most of the work, but the command input method and failure level should be set before calling this constructor.

Parameters:
nodeImpl - The Class object for the student's node implementation
seed - Seed for the random number generator. Can be null to use the current time as a seed
replayOutputFilename - The log file for future relays of the current execution
replayInputFilename - The log file to replay
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the arguments provided to the program are invalid
java.io.IOException - If creating the user input reader fails

Simulator

public Simulator(java.lang.Class<? extends Node> nodeImpl,
                 Manager.FailureLvl failureGen,
                 java.lang.Long seed,
                 java.lang.String replayOutputFilename,
                 java.lang.String replayInputFilename,
                 java.lang.String commandFile)
          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                 java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                 java.io.IOException
Constructor for a simulator that takes commands from a file.

Parameters:
nodeImpl - The Class object for the student's node implementation
failureGen - How failures should be generated
seed - Seed for the RNG. This can be null.
replayOutputFilename - The log file for future relays of the current execution
replayInputFilename - The log file to replay
commandfile - File containing the list of commands
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the arguments provided to the program are invalid
java.io.FileNotFoundException - If the command file does not exist
java.io.IOException - If creating the user input reader fails

start

protected void start()
Methods for starting and stopping the simulation

Specified by:
start in class Manager

stop

protected void stop()
Description copied from class: Manager
Stops MessageLayer. This method should not return

Overrides:
stop in class Manager

startNode

private void startNode(int node)
Start up a node, crashed or brand new. If the node is alive, this method will crash it first.

Parameters:
node - The address at which to start the node

failNode

private Node.NodeCrashException failNode(int node)
Fail a node. This method updates data structures, removes the failed nodes's timeouts and calls its fail() method

Parameters:
node - The node address to fail
Returns:
The exception thrown after calling the fail() method. This is so, if the stack includes methods in Node, we can rethrow the Exception as necessary

checkWriteCrash

protected void checkWriteCrash(Node n,
                               java.lang.String description)
Description copied from class: Manager
Check if we should crash before a write.

Specified by:
checkWriteCrash in class Manager
Parameters:
n - The node that is trying to write to the disc.
description - The description of the write so the user knows what caused the crash

private void checkInTransit(java.util.ArrayList<Event> currentRoundEvents)
Goes through all of the in transit messages and decides whether to drop, delay, or deliver.

Parameters:
currentRoundEvents - The list of the current round's events that we should add to

executeEvents

private void executeEvents(java.util.ArrayList<Event> currentRoundEvents)
Reorders and executes all the events for the current round. Note that commands can be executed in a different order than they appear in the command file!

Parameters:
currentRoundEvents - The list of the current round's events that we should add to

handleEvent

private void handleEvent(Event ev)
Process an event.

Parameters:
ev - The event that should be processed

sendPkt

protected void sendPkt(Node fromNode,
                       int to,
                       int protocol,
                       byte[] payload)
                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Create a packet and put it on the channel. Crashes in the middle of a broadcast can be modeled by a post-send crash, plus a sequence of dropped messages

Overrides:
sendPkt in class Manager
Parameters:
fromNode - The node that is sending the packet
to - Integer specifying the destination node
protocol - The protocol of the message
payload - The payload to be sent, serialized to a byte array
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the send is invalid

deliverPkt

private void deliverPkt(Packet pkt)
Actually deliver an in transit packet to its intended destination.

Parameters:
destAddr - The address of the recipient
destNode - The node object of the recipient
srcAddr - The address of the sender
pkt - The packet that should be delivered

sendNodeCmd

private void sendNodeCmd(int nodeAddr,
                         java.lang.String msg)
Sends command to the specified node

Parameters:
nodeAddr - Address of the node to whom the message should be sent
msg - The msg to send to the node

validNodeAddress

protected static boolean validNodeAddress(int addr)
Check if the address is valid

Parameters:
addr - The address to check
Returns:
true if the address is valid, false otherwise

isNodeValid

private boolean isNodeValid(int nodeAddr)
Check whether a given node is live and therefore valid to give msgs/cmds. Additionally, an error message will print out if the address itself is invalid.

Parameters:
nodeAddr - The node for which we want to check validity
Returns:
true If the node is alive, false if not.

printLiveDead

private void printLiveDead()
Print out a list of live and crashed nodes in a human-readable way.

logEvent

private void logEvent(Node node,
                      java.lang.String eventStr)
Log the event in the synoptic log using the simulator's global logical ordering

Parameters:
node - node generating the event
eventStr - the event string description of the event
